Node.Notes: Parenthetical clause introducing Paul’s interpretation of the OT passage he has just quoted.
Parenthetical clause introducing Paul’s interpretation of the OT passage he has just quoted.
Parenthetical clause introducing Paul’s interpretation of the OT passage he has just quoted.

May be explicative or causal. Tree assumes the latter: The statement of v. 8 (is near you, in your mouth and in your heart) is true, because all that one has to do, in order to be saved, is to confess and believe as stated.

Node.English: will not be put to shame.
will not be put to shame.

Node.Notes: Prepositions from and through indicate origin/source and means respectively, indicating implied existential processes: Faith [comes] from hearing and hearing [comes] from the word of Christ.
